poem:
### Grades

"Outstanding," they tagged,
but classrooms sighed.
Glossy labels peeled,
truth, unlacquered, tried.

Good meant grasping,
fingers just shy of stars.
Fine was our failing,
mirrors masked with scars.

In clipped words,
a silent space we find,
where meaning fell, tangled,
at the orbit of the mind.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Good riddance. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
